ai-snp3.12:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ai-snp3.12:1.3_0: Now, at that time it was the sabbath—the full moon on the fifteenth day—and the Buddha was sitting in the open surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks.
ai-snp3.12:1.4_0: Then the Buddha looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were so very silent. He addressed them,
ai-snp3.12:2.1_0: “Mendicants, those things are noble ones who lead out to the noble ones, who leads out to the company of the noble ones, and who practices it to the company of the noble ones. They say:
ai-snp3.12:2.2_0: ‘Then is the right time to truly know about the teachings.’
ai-snp3.12:2.3_0: And why would you call them a bond?
ai-snp3.12:3.1_0: This is the noble truth of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:3.2_0: This is the second practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:3.3_0: A mendicant who meditates in this way can expect one of two results:
ai-snp3.12:3.4_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
ai-snp3.12:4.1_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-snp3.12:4.2_0: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
ai-snp3.12:5.1_0: “There are those who don’t understand suffering
ai-snp3.12:5.5_0: And they don’t know the path
ai-snp3.12:5.6_0: that leads to the stilling of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:6.4_0: they continue to be reborn and grow old.
ai-snp3.12:7.6_0: that leads to the stilling of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:8.1_0: They’re endowed with the heart’s release,
ai-snp3.12:8.4_0: they don’t continue to be reborn and grow old.
ai-snp3.12:9.1_0: ‘Perhaps there is another way of mortification in one who is rightly explained.’ Thus there is no longer contemplation.
ai-snp3.12:9.4_0: Whatever is suffering, all is the contemplation of one.
ai-snp3.12:9.5_0: But when clinging to fade away and cease with nothing left over, then continued existence does not come to be.
ai-snp3.12:9.7_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:10.3_0: The foolish one, without wisdom, clings to a basis,
ai-snp3.12:10.4_0: that idiot returns to suffering again and again.
ai-snp3.12:10.5_0: So let one who understands not build up attachments:
ai-snp3.12:10.6_0: seeing the birth and origin of suffering,
ai-snp3.12:11.1_0: ‘Perhaps there is another way of mortification in one who is rightly explained.’ Thus there is no longer contemplation.
ai-snp3.12:11.4_0: Whatever is suffering, there is for all suffering, and ignorance.
ai-snp3.12:11.5_0: But when ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, there is no origination of suffering. This is the second end.
ai-snp3.12:11.7_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:12.2_0: are tossed away in the future.
ai-snp3.12:13.1_0: Having abandoned ignorance, the great hero,
ai-snp3.12:13.3_0: There are beings who are endowed with wisdom,
ai-snp3.12:13.4_0: they will not come back to future lives.
ai-snp3.12:14.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:14.3_0: Whatever is suffering, so is the contemplation of (volitional) processes.
ai-snp3.12:14.4_0: But when intentional activities fade away and cease with nothing left over, there is no origination of suffering. This is the second way that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:14.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:15.4_0: now there is no origination of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:16.2_0: with a (volitional) process as condition: suffering,
ai-snp3.12:16.5_0: That’s how the end of suffering is developed.
ai-snp3.12:16.6_0: Having understood this, you must practice
ai-snp3.12:17.3_0: then, when overcome by Māra’s snares,
ai-snp3.12:17.4_0: never return to any future lives.
ai-snp3.12:18.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:18.3_0: Whatever is suffering, so is the contemplation of consciousness.
ai-snp3.12:18.4_0: But with the complete fading away and cessation of consciousness, there is no origin of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:18.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:19.2_0: all is to be experienced as consciousness.
ai-snp3.12:19.4_0: now there is no origination of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:21.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:21.3_0: Whatever is suffering, there is no contact for them.
ai-snp3.12:21.4_0: But when contact fade away and cease with nothing left over, contact ceases. This is the second way that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:21.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:22.2_0: flowing along the stream of lives,
ai-snp3.12:23.1_0: But those who completely understand contact,
ai-snp3.12:23.2_0: But the one who loves them is happy.
ai-snp3.12:24.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:24.3_0: Whatever is suffering, there is for all feelings, and unpleasant feelings,
ai-snp3.12:24.4_0: But when feeling ceases with nothing left over, then continued existence ceases. This is the second end of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:24.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:26.3_0: it’s still possible to see the truth.
ai-snp3.12:26.4_0: In that place they know there,
ai-snp3.12:26.5_0: With the ending of feelings, a mendicant
ai-snp3.12:27.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:27.3_0: Whatever is suffering, there is no craving for continued existence.
ai-snp3.12:27.4_0: But when craving ceases with nothing left over, then continued existence ceases. This is the second end of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:27.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:28.2_0: as they transmigrate on this long journey.
ai-snp3.12:29.2_0: that craving is the cause of suffering—
ai-snp3.12:29.3_0: Rid of craving, free of grasping,
ai-snp3.12:30.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:30.3_0: Whatever is suffering, so is the contemplation of all suffering.
ai-snp3.12:30.4_0: But when grasping ceases, grasping ceases. When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases. When continued existence ceases, continued existence ceases. This is the second way that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:30.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:31.4_0: this is the cause of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:32.1_0: That’s why it comes to the end of grasping.
ai-snp3.12:32.3_0: who have deep knowledge of rebirth,
ai-snp3.12:32.4_0: never return to any future lives.
ai-snp3.12:33.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:33.3_0: Whatever is suffering, there is no fault for others.
ai-snp3.12:33.4_0: But when desire fades away and cease with nothing left over, there is no further existence. This is the second end of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:33.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:34.2_0: all is because of harm will be done.
ai-snp3.12:34.4_0: now there is no origination of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:35.2_0: Suffering is a condition for suffering.
ai-snp3.12:35.3_0: With the giving up of all faults,
ai-snp3.12:36.1_0: For the mendicant with peaceful mind,
ai-snp3.12:36.4_0: there are no future lives for them.
ai-snp3.12:37.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:37.3_0: Whatever is suffering, there is no desire for nutriment.
ai-snp3.12:37.4_0: But when desire fades away and ceases with nothing left over, there is no further existence. This is the second end.
ai-snp3.12:37.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:38.2_0: all is dependent on the food.
ai-snp3.12:38.4_0: now there is no origination of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:39.2_0: Suffering is a condition for suffering.
ai-snp3.12:40.3_0: that knowledge-master is firm in principle;
ai-snp3.12:40.4_0: they use reckonings, but can’t be reckoned.
ai-snp3.12:41.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:41.3_0: Whatever suffering has come to be, all is the mode of one who is undetermined, with not-self.
ai-snp3.12:41.4_0: But with the complete fading away and cessation of suffering without anything left over, there is no further existence. This is the second end of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:41.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:42.4_0: now there is no origination of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:43.2_0: suffering is a condition for growing old.
ai-snp3.12:43.4_0: Cut down a (volitional) process that’s filthy,
ai-snp3.12:44.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:44.3_0: For the one who is created, and through insight knowledge is the repulsiveness of conditions.
ai-snp3.12:44.4_0: This is the second kind of contemplation.
ai-snp3.12:44.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:46.3_0: by not grasping, by not grasping:
ai-snp3.12:47.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:47.3_0: The formless states are more peaceful than states of form;
ai-snp3.12:47.4_0: This is the second kind of cessation.
ai-snp3.12:47.6_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:48.1_0: “There are beings in the realm of luminous form,
ai-snp3.12:48.2_0: and others established in the formless.
ai-snp3.12:49.1_0: But those who completely understand sensual pleasures,
ai-snp3.12:49.3_0: those who are released in cessation,
ai-snp3.12:50.1_0: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are different ...’
ai-snp3.12:50.3_0: In this world with its gods, its lords of death, and its supreme beings, in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans, it is the truth that I have truly seen clearly with right wisdom that: “This is well seen with right wisdom that is oppressed.
ai-snp3.12:50.5_0: And with right wisdom that is conceived in a heavenly realm. This is the second truth that’s contemplation.
ai-snp3.12:50.7_0: Then the Teacher, said something more:
ai-snp3.12:51.2_0: see the world with its gods,
ai-snp3.12:52.3_0: for you have a lie once.
ai-snp3.12:52.4_0: When you’re fellows in this state,
ai-snp3.12:53.1_0: that which has an undeceptive nature—extinguishment.
ai-snp3.12:54.1_0: ‘Perhaps there is another way of mortification in one who is rightly explained.’ Thus there is no longer contemplation.
ai-snp3.12:54.4_0: In this world with its gods, its lords of death, and its supreme beings, in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans, it is the path to truly see that that they are painful ...”
ai-snp3.12:54.5_1: And with right wisdom that is their second.
ai-snp3.12:54.6_0: A mendicant who meditates in this way can expect one of two results:
ai-snp3.12:54.7_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
ai-snp3.12:54.8_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-snp3.12:54.9_0: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
ai-snp3.12:55.2_0: touches, and thoughts, the lot of them—
ai-snp3.12:55.4_0: as long as you can say that they exist.
ai-snp3.12:56.1_0: in all the world with its gods,
ai-snp3.12:56.4_0: it’s not painful to have reckoned as suffering.
ai-snp3.12:57.1_0: Compassion is happy when they see;
ai-snp3.12:58.2_0: the noble ones say is suffering.
ai-snp3.12:58.4_0: the noble ones say is happiness.
ai-snp3.12:59.1_0: See, this teaching is hard to understand,
ai-snp3.12:59.2_0: it seems to me like a fish-neezer.
ai-snp3.12:59.4_0: for them, all is blind darkness.
ai-snp3.12:60.1_0: But those who see are open;
ai-snp3.12:60.2_0: for the good, it is light.
ai-snp3.12:60.3_0: Though it’s right there, the unskilled fools
ai-snp3.12:60.4_0: who are learned in the teachings,
ai-snp3.12:61.1_0: not by greed or hate or delusion,
ai-snp3.12:61.2_0: flowing along the stream of lives,
ai-snp3.12:61.4_0: by those mired in greed and hate.
ai-snp3.12:62.1_0: Who is the Mallas’ Prinibbāna in the Mallas?
ai-snp3.12:62.2_0: is qualified to understand this state?
ai-snp3.12:63.1_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-snp3.12:63.2_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-snp3.12:63.3_0: And while this discourse was being spoken, the minds of sixty mendicants were freed from defilements by not grasping.
ai-snp3.12:64.4_0: Grasping off the attachment to grasping,
ai-snp3.12:64.7_0: The third sub-chapter on great fire is finished.
ai-snp3.12:66.3_0: Twelve years when you’ve been well spoken:
